item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Deploying the Ansible Edge GitOps pattern Prerequisites An OpenShift cluster To create an OpenShift cluster, go to the Red Hat Hybrid Cloud console.

item.title: Installation Details
item.description: Installation Steps These are the steps run by make install and what each one does: operator-deploy The operator-deploy task installs the Validated Patterns Operator, which in turn creates a subscription for the OpenShift GitOps operator and installs both the cluster and hub instances of it.

item.title: Ansible Automation Platform
item.description: Logging in to the Ansible Automation Platform The default login user for the AAP interface is admin, and the password is randomly generated during installation.

item.title: Ideas for Customization
item.description: Why customize the pattern A key goal of the Red Hat patterns development process is to create modular, customizable demos.

item.title: Cluster sizing
item.description: The OpenShift cluster is made of 3 Control Plane nodes and 3 Workers for the cluster; 3 workers are standard compute nodes and one is c5n.

item.title: OpenShift Virtualization
item.description: OpenShift Virtualization Default OpenShift Virtualization templates OpenShift virtualization expects to install virtual machines from image templates by default, and provides several OpenShift templates to facilitate this.
